original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations

original: Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (2)
analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma
translated: The Book of the Pairs in the Order of Coming Forth

original: 20.2. Cūḷantaraduka
analyzed: cūḍantaraduka
translated: The Shorter Section on the Twos

original: Naappaccayaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaccayo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na appaccayam dhammam paṭicca sappaccayaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a condition as its support, a conditionally-arisen state of consciousness arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.
analyzed: ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With root-cause condition as one factor, … with non-hindrance condition as one factor.

original: Naasaṅkhataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saṅkhato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na asaṅkhatam dhammam paṭicca saṅkhataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With an unconditioned state as its support, a conditioned state arises, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nasanidassanaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassano dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasanidassanaṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassano dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasanidassanaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: ekam pe avigate eka  na sa nidassanam dhammam paṭicca sa nidassanaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sa nidassana  dhammam paṭicca anidassanaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sanidassanam dhammam paṭicca
translated: With root-cause condition as one factor, … with non-hindrance condition as one factor.🔽With a visible state as its support, a visible state arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a visible state as its support, an invisible state arises, by way of root-cause condition. With a visible state as its support,

original: sanidassano ca anidassano ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā🔽tīṇi, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: sa nidassanaḥ ca anidassanaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā  tīṇi ārammaṇe ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: a visible state and an invisible state arise, by way of root-cause condition. (Abbreviated.) With root-cause condition as one factor, … with non-hindrance condition as one factor.🔽With object condition as one factor, … with non-hindrance condition as one factor.

original: Nasanidassano dhammo sanidassanassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na sa nidassanaḥ dhammaḥ sa nidassanassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: With a visible state as its support, a visible state arises, by way of root-cause condition. … with three factors.

original: Nasanidassano dhammo anidassanassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Naanidassano dhammo anidassanassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sa nidassanaḥ dhammaḥ anidassanassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ na anidassanaḥ dhammaḥ anidassanassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: A visible-data-object dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for a non-visible-data dhamma. A non-visible-data dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for a non-visible-data dhamma. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā cattāri, anantare samanantare ekaṁ, sahajāte
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā cattāri anantare samanantare eka sahajāte
translated: In the case of cause, there are three; in the case of object, there are two; in the case of predominance, there are four; in the case of proximity, in the case of contiguity, there is one; in the case of arising together,

original: tīṇi, aññamaññe ekaṁ, nissaye tīṇi, upanissaye dve, purejāte pacchājāte tīṇi, āsevane
analyzed: tīṇi aññamaññe eka nissaye tīṇi upanissaye dve purejāte pacchājāte tīṇi āsevane
translated: there are three; in the case of conascence, there is one; in the case of support, there are three; in the case of nutriment, in the case of a road, in the case of a basis, in the case of space, in the case of a faculty, there are two; in the case of prenascence, in the case of postnascence, in the case of repetition,

original: ekaṁ, kamme tīṇi, vipāke …pe… magge tīṇi, sampayutte ekaṁ, vippayutte tīṇi …pe… avigate pañca.🔽Nasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasappaṭighaṁ
analyzed: eka kamme tīṇi vipāke pe magge tīṇi sampayutte eka vippayutte tīṇi pe avigate pañca  na sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sappaṭigha
translated: there are three; in the case of kamma, there are three; in the case of result, … in the case of nutriment, there are four; in the case of a condition, there are five.🔽With respect to “a non-obstacle dhamma … a non-hindrance dhamma,” etc.,🔽With respect to “a non-obstacle dhamma … a non-hindrance dhamma,” etc.,

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca appaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽sappaṭigho ca appaṭigho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sappaṭigham dhammam paṭicca 🔽sappaṭighaḥ ca appaṭighaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With respect to “a non-obstacle dhamma … a non-hindrance dhamma,” etc.,

original: Naappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca appaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naappaṭighaṁ
analyzed: na appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca appaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na appaṭigha
translated: With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Naappaṭighaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na appaṭigham dhammam paṭicca
translated: With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …

original: sappaṭigho ca appaṭigho ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sappaṭighaḥ ca appaṭighaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …

original: Nasappaṭighañca naappaṭighañca dhammaṁ paṭicca sappaṭigho dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na sappaṭigham ca na appaṭigham ca dhammam paṭicca sappaṭighaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe ekaṁ …pe… aññamaññe cha …pe… avigate nava.🔽Narūpiṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca rūpī dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe ekam pe aññamaññe cha pe avigate nava  na rūpim dhammam paṭicca rūpī dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā pañca …pe… aññamaññe cha …pe… purejāte āsevane ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava.🔽Nalokiyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca lokiyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nalokiyaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā pañca pe aññamaññe cha pe purejāte āsevane ekam pe avigate nava 🔽na lokiyam dhammam paṭicca lokiyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na lokiyam dhamma
translated: With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …🔽With a non-adherent object …

original: paṭicca lokuttaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nalokiyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca lokiyo
analyzed: paṭicca lokuttaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na lokiyam dhammam paṭicca lokiyaḥ
translated: A supramundane state arises with a supramundane state as its condition by way of root condition.

original: ca lokuttaro ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.🔽Nalokuttaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca lokiyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: ca lokuttaraḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā  na lokuttaram dhammam paṭicca lokiyaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A mundane and a supramundane state arise with a mundane state as their condition by way of root condition.🔽A mundane state arises with a supramundane state as its condition by way of root condition.

original: Nalokiyañca nalokuttarañca dhammaṁ paṭicca lokiyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (1.) (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na lokiyam ca na lokuttaram ca dhammam paṭicca lokiyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A mundane state arises with a mundane and a supramundane state as its condition by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca
translated: In the section on root, there are five. In the section on object, there are two. … In the section on non-hindrance, there are five.

original: Nakenaci viññeyyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca kenaci viññeyyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na kenacid viññeyyam dhammam paṭicca kenacid viññeyyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state cognizable by the eye arises with a state cognizable by the eye as its condition by way of root condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava pe avigate nava
translated: In the section on root, there are nine. … In the section on non-hindrance, there are nine.
